alfredsnippet.snippet:
"Benjamin Franklin, the renowned scientist, philosopher, statesman, and inventor, holds a special spot in the IEEE's history: his famous kite is the model for the institute's diamond-shaped logo. Franklin lived in London between 1757 and 1775. During his stint there, he was the ambassador from the American colonies, but he also continued to pursue his true love, scientific experiments, in the house at 36 Craven Lane."

- unknown source
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Franklin's Famous Kite is the Model for IEEE's Logo
